intro: Trigonella corniculata var. elatior, commonly known as the greater horned vetch, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a leguminous species characterized by its trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas. It has a climbing habit, using its tendrils to support itself on other plants or structures. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in nitrogen fixation in agricultural systems.
